text.Prompt:
Scotiabank has agreed to buy U.S. bank JPMorgan Chase's credit card portfolio in Canada, which includes the Sears Canada credit cards.

The bank announced the deal Thursday, but did not release financial terms.

Scotiabank is acquiring JPMorgan's MasterCard and Sears card portfolio, along with the call centre and security operations associated with the cards. It is Scotiabank's first foray into MasterCard in Canada.

It gains about two million credit card customers and receivables of about $1.7 billion a year.

"This transaction is in line with our strategy to grow Scotiabank's payments business, including credit cards, while providing our shareholders with attractive risk adjusted returns," said James O'Sullivan, group head of Canadian banking at Scotiabank.

Troubled retailer Sears Canada has been seeking a new partner to handle its credit card for the past year after JPMorgan announced it would terminate their agreement Nov. 15.

Scotiabank has rested part of its growth strategy on an expanded credit card business, partnering with Cineplex and buying 20 per cent of Canadian Tire's financial services business.

Generate a summary:
text.Response A: A Canadian bank has bought out a U.S. bank's credit card portfolio in Canada.  The bank didn't say how much money they paid, but it sounds like a lot.  The bank will also get call centres and security operations.  The bank also said it's going to get about 2 million credit card customers and a lot of money every year.  It's going to help the bank grow its business.  The retailer Sears Canada was looking for a new partner for its credit card after the other one said they were going to end their agreement.
text.Response B: The Canadian division of U.S. bank JPMorgan Chase has announced that it is selling its credit card portfolio in Canada to Scotiabank. The deal, which has not been disclosed in financial terms, includes the Sears Canada credit cards, as well as the MasterCard and Sears card portfolios, and associated call centre and security operations. The transaction will help Scotiabank to grow its payments business, including credit cards, and provide attractive risk-adjusted returns to its shareholders. The troubled retailer Sears Canada has been seeking a new partner to handle its credit card business for the past year, after JPMorgan announced it would terminate its agreement with the company on 15th November.

meta.preamble_a: Respond using only short words and simple language, as if you were talking to a child.
meta.preamble_b: Respond using complex language, long words and technical terms, as if you are an expert.

72.displayed_text:
Prompt

Scotiabank has agreed to buy U.S. bank JPMorgan Chase's credit card portfolio in Canada, which includes the Sears Canada credit cards.

The bank announced the deal Thursday, but did not release financial terms.

Scotiabank is acquiring JPMorgan's MasterCard and Sears card portfolio, along with the call centre and security operations associated with the cards. It is Scotiabank's first foray into MasterCard in Canada.

It gains about two million credit card customers and receivables of about $1.7 billion a year.

"This transaction is in line with our strategy to grow Scotiabank's payments business, including credit cards, while providing our shareholders with attractive risk adjusted returns," said James O'Sullivan, group head of Canadian banking at Scotiabank.

Troubled retailer Sears Canada has been seeking a new partner to handle its credit card for the past year after JPMorgan announced it would terminate their agreement Nov. 15.

Scotiabank has rested part of its growth strategy on an expanded credit card business, partnering with Cineplex and buying 20 per cent of Canadian Tire's financial services business.

Generate a summary:

Response A

A Canadian bank has bought out a U.S. bank's credit card portfolio in Canada. The bank didn't say how much money they paid, but it sounds like a lot. The bank will also get call centres and security operations. The bank also said it's going to get about 2 million credit card customers and a lot of money every year. It's going to help the bank grow its business. The retailer Sears Canada was looking for a new partner for its credit card after the other one said they were going to end their agreement.

Response B

The Canadian division of U.S. bank JPMorgan Chase has announced that it is selling its credit card portfolio in Canada to Scotiabank. The deal, which has not been disclosed in financial terms, includes the Sears Canada credit cards, as well as the MasterCard and Sears card portfolios, and associated call centre and security operations. The transaction will help Scotiabank to grow its payments business, including credit cards, and provide attractive risk-adjusted returns to its shareholders. The troubled retailer Sears Canada has been seeking a new partner to handle its credit card business for the past year, after JPMorgan announced it would terminate its agreement with the company on 15th November.
